2022-06-23.name: Summerfest
2022-06-23.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-06-23.name: Swedish Days Festival
2022-06-23.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2022-06-23.name: Country Fest
2022-06-23.summary: This year's big outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Jason Aldean, Florida Georgia Line and Lee Brice.

2022-06-23.name: Lakes Jam
2022-06-23.summary: Tesla, Jon Pardi and Cole Swindell are among the headliners at this music-and-camping festival at Brainerd International Raceway.

2022-06-23.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2022-06-23.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is near Eau Claire.

2022-06-23.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-23.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-24.name: Summerfest
2022-06-24.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-06-24.name: Swedish Days Festival
2022-06-24.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2022-06-24.name: Musky Fest
2022-06-24.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2022-06-24.name: Water Ski Days
2022-06-24.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2022-06-24.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2022-06-24.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2022-06-24.name: Country Fest
2022-06-24.summary: This year's big outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Jason Aldean, Florida Georgia Line and Lee Brice.

2022-06-24.name: Lakes Jam
2022-06-24.summary: Tesla, Jon Pardi and Cole Swindell are among the headliners at this music-and-camping festival at Brainerd International Raceway.

2022-06-24.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2022-06-24.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is near Eau Claire.

2022-06-24.name: Twin Cities Jazz Festival
2022-06-24.summary: Listen to jazz in Mears Park, in St. Paul's Lowertown.

2022-06-24.name: Wings Over Wausau
2022-06-24.summary: This air show at Downtown Airport also features live music, children's activities, food and fireworks both nights.

2022-06-24.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2022-06-24.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2022-06-24.name: Soo Locks Engineers Day
2022-06-24.summary:
It's the biggest day of the year for boat nerds at the Soo Locks. 
There's a Coast Guard open house, and Portage Avenue will be closed to vehicle traffic, for an arts, crafts and family fun fair.

2022-06-24.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-24.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-24.name: Midwest Viking Festival
2022-06-24.summary: This festival in Viking Ship Park includes a Viking battle performance, storytelling, artisan demonstrators and Nordic food that tell about society and culture in Viking-age Scandinavia and beyond.

2022-06-25.name: Summerfest
2022-06-25.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-06-25.name: Swedish Days Festival
2022-06-25.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2022-06-25.name: Musky Fest
2022-06-25.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2022-06-25.name: Water Ski Days
2022-06-25.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2022-06-25.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2022-06-25.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2022-06-25.name: Strawberry Festival
2022-06-25.summary: During this popular event in an old mill town north of Milwaukee, there's music, kids' games, a rubber-duck race, shortcake-eating and bubblegum-blowing contests and strawberries in everything  — brats, wine, slush.

2022-06-25.name: Afton Strawberry Festival
2022-06-25.summary: This village on the St. Croix River offers an art fair, music, games, raptor demos and a strawberry shortcake-eating contest.

2022-06-25.name: ChalkFest
2022-06-25.summary: Artists of all ages decorate the 400 Block of downtown.

2022-06-25.name: Country Fest
2022-06-25.summary: This year's big outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features Jason Aldean, Florida Georgia Line and Lee Brice.

2022-06-25.name: Lakes Jam
2022-06-25.summary: Tesla, Jon Pardi and Cole Swindell are among the headliners at this music-and-camping festival at Brainerd International Raceway.

2022-06-25.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2022-06-25.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is near Eau Claire.

2022-06-25.name: Twin Cities Jazz Festival
2022-06-25.summary: Listen to jazz in Mears Park, in St. Paul's Lowertown.

2022-06-25.name: Wings Over Wausau
2022-06-25.summary: This air show at Downtown Airport also features live music, children's activities, food and fireworks both nights.

2022-06-25.name: Big Top Parade & Circus Celebration
2022-06-25.summary: In the downtown square, there will be circus-themed performances, walking tours, music, children's activities and a Big Top parade.

2022-06-25.name: International Bridge Walk
2022-06-25.summary: Walk across the St. Mary's River to Canada at 9:30 a.m. or ride a bike there and back between 8:30 and 9:30 a.m. Walkers can take a bus back from Sault Ste. Marie, Ont., for $5 and must bring a passport. Otherwise, the event is free.

2022-06-25.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2022-06-25.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2022-06-25.name: Spring Iowa Barn Tour
2022-06-25.summary: This self-guided tour of historic barns concentrates on barns in the historic turkey center of Story City, Ellsworth and Radcliffe.

2022-06-25.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-25.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-25.name: Midwest Viking Festival
2022-06-25.summary: This festival in Viking Ship Park includes a Viking battle performance, storytelling, artisan demonstrators and Nordic food that tell about society and culture in Viking-age Scandinavia and beyond.

2022-06-30.name: Summerfest
2022-06-30.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-06-30.name: Riverfest
2022-06-30.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers.

2022-06-30.name: Petunia Festival
2022-06-30.summary: This festival in the Hometown of Ronald Reagan features music, a carnival, fireworks and a parade.

2022-06-30.name: National Women's Music Festival
2022-06-30.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2022-06-30.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2022-06-30.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks.

2022-06-30.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-30.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-11.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2022-06-11.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2022-06-11.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-11.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-11.name: Aquafest
2022-06-11.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-11.name: Blues Festival
2022-06-11.summary: This year, the largest of Chicago's free music festivals will be held in venues around town as well as in Millennium Park.

2022-06-11.name: Butterfest
2022-06-11.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2022-06-11.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2022-06-11.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.

2022-06-11.name: Polish Fest
2022-06-11.summary: This big festival on the lakefront features lots of hearty food, a piano contest, storytelling, vodka-tasting, folk arts and polka dancing.

2022-06-11.name: Spring Lighthouse Festival
2022-06-11.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum in Sturgeon Bay offers tours of the peninsula's 11 lighthouses by foot, boat, trolley, minibus and airplane. Tickets go on sale to the public in March; some tours sell out quickly.

2022-06-11.name: Windsurfing Regatta & Music Festival
2022-06-11.summary: This breezy town in southwest Minnesota hosts windsurfing races on Lake Okabena and a free music festival. There will also be children's activities, a bike ride and a fun run.

2022-06-11.name: Walleye Weekend
2022-06-11.summary: In addition to a fishing tournament, this free family fest features live music on four stages, a Friday parade and strongman, volleyball and cornhole competitions, plus a Familyland for small children and a Teen Village with a climbing wall and giant obstacle course.

2022-06-11.name: Country Thunder Iowa Music Festival
2022-06-11.summary: The country-music festival in this town near Clear Lake features Lee Brice, Kip Moore and Chris Young. There's camping (and glamping) onsite.

2022-06-11.name: Midsommarfest
2022-06-11.summary: This street festival in the historically Swedish neighborhood of Chicago features Maypole dancing, music, international food, an artisan market and children's activities.

2022-06-11.name: Marquette Waterfront Festival
2022-06-11.summary: In Yahara Place Park on Lake Monona, there's music on two stages, children's games and craft-beer and wine tents.

2022-06-11.name: Old Town Art Fair
2022-06-11.summary: In the Old Town neighborhood, there will be more than 200 juried fine artists, a garden walk, live music and children's activities.

2022-06-11.name: Wine & Food Festival
2022-06-11.summary: Sample local wines and listen to music at this festival on the Leelanau Peninsula.

2022-06-11.name: PorchFest
2022-06-11.summary: During this afternoon music festival, 19 bands perform for 45 minutes each on porches around town. There will be food vendors, too.

2022-06-15.name: Steamboat Days
2022-06-15.summary: The main event is the 12:31 p.m. Sunday parade, one of the region's largest. There's also a carnival, craft show, music, power-boat races, a car show and fireworks.

2022-06-15.name: Ice Cream Days
2022-06-15.summary: The festival in this northwest Iowa town, home of Blue Bunny ice cream, includes an art fair, old-fashioned children's games, architectural tours, a polo match, airplane and helicopter stunts and a parade at 9 a.m. Saturday. And the ice cream is free.

2022-06-15.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-15.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-15.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-15.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-16.name: Bridgefest
2022-06-16.summary: There will be helicopter rides, a water-ski show, a Friday parade and Saturday fireworks. The two towns are linked by the Keweenaw Peninsula's massive Portage Lift Bridge.

2022-06-16.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-16.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-16.name: Rose Festival
2022-06-16.summary: This town east of Ames calls itself Iowa's rose capital, and it celebrates with garden tours, children's games, a truck and tractor pull, music, fireworks and a parade at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2022-06-17.summary: There will be helicopter rides, a water-ski show, a Friday parade and Saturday fireworks. The two towns are linked by the Keweenaw Peninsula's massive Portage Lift Bridge.

2022-06-17.name: Great Galena Balloon Race
2022-06-17.summary: Eagle Ridge Resort hosts two balloon races, two night glows and rides for the public. There's also live music, inflatables for kids, a Saturday art fair and a classic car show Saturday night.

2022-06-17.name: Wooden Boat Show and Summer Solstice Festival
2022-06-17.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School on Lake Superior kicks off summer with a boat parade, dancing, craft demonstrations, mini-courses and a solstice parade.

2022-06-17.name: Winstock Country Festival
2022-06-17.summary: Jake Owen and Tim McGraw headline this festival just west of Minneapolis.

2022-06-17.name: Sol Grass Music Festival
2022-06-17.summary: This bluegrass festival is off the Door Peninsula, and tickets include tent camping.

2022-06-17.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-17.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-17.name: Perham Turtle Fest
2022-06-17.summary: This town in the northwest Minnesota lakes region features turtle races, music, trolley rides, kids' games, a pizza-eating contest, a parade at 6:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday fireworks.

2022-06-17.name: Rose Festival
2022-06-17.summary: This town east of Ames calls itself Iowa's rose capital, and it celebrates with garden tours, children's games, a truck and tractor pull, music, fireworks and a parade at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2022-06-17.name: Harborfest
2022-06-17.summary: There will be a wooden boat show, dragon-boat racing, kids' activities, music and a craft fair.

2022-06-17.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2022-06-17.summary: A 131-mile yard sale along U.S. 34 from Aurora to Galesburg, with events in many towns.

2022-06-18.name: Stone Arch Bridge Festival
2022-06-18.summary:
On the banks of the Mississippi, 200 artists show their wares. There will also be music, art for kids and a car show. 
The fair is not on the Stone Arch Bridge but on the west side of the river between Portland and North Fourth Avenue.

2022-06-18.name: Fyr Bal Festival
2022-06-18.summary: It's the annual Scandinavian midsummer festival in this Door County village. There's a regatta, historic walking tours, artisan market, trolley rides, Fur Ball pet parade, cake walk and ice-cream and cherry-pie eating contests.

2022-06-18.name: Wurst Festival
2022-06-18.summary: Besides sausage sampling, there will be music, a dachshund derby, a beer-stein holding contest and hotdog games.

2022-06-18.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-18.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-18.summary: This town east of Ames calls itself Iowa's rose capital, and it celebrates with garden tours, children's games, a truck and tractor pull, music, fireworks and a parade at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2022-06-18.name: Harborfest
2022-06-18.summary: There will be a wooden boat show, dragon-boat racing, kids' activities, music and a craft fair.

2022-06-18.name: Juneteenth
2022-06-18.summary: With music, dance, food and family activities, this festival in Bethune Park commemorates the ending of slavery in 1865.

2022-06-19.name: Swedish Day
2022-06-19.summary: This heritage festival in Good Templar Park includes Maypole dancing, Viking reenactors, children's crafts, food and a Swedish market.

2022-06-19.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-19.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-03.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-03.name: Aquafest
2022-06-03.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-03.name: Buffalo Days
2022-06-03.summary: This festival in the southwest corner of Minnesota features a cow-chip throwing contest, fire-truck ladder rides, duck races, an arts show and a big parade on Saturday.

2022-06-03.name: Fresh Art Spring Tour
2022-06-03.summary: Artists' studios and gardens will be open along the Mississippi and in the bluffs between Maiden Rock and Pepin in western Wisconsin.

2022-06-03.name: Edina Art Fair
2022-06-03.summary: The juried show in this posh southern Minneapolis suburb draws 375 exhibitors and 60,000 people.

2022-06-03.name: Spring Art Tour
2022-06-03.summary: Artists open their studios in Mount Horeb and other towns in the Wisconsin River valley: Mazomanie, Black Earth, Cross Plains, Blue Mounds and Verona.

2022-06-03.name: 2 Rivers Wine Festival
2022-06-03.summary: The festival in this town on the Fox and Illinois rivers features wine from 25 Illinois vineyards and jazz and blues in Washington Park.

2022-06-03.name: Festa Italia
2022-06-03.summary: The heritage festival at McKee Farms Park in this Madison suburb features such things as folk dancing, a puppet show, a pasta-eating contest and vintage baseball as well as bocce ball.

2022-06-03.name: Street Faire at the Lakes
2022-06-03.summary: This western-Minnesota lake town hosts a juried arts show with music, fair food and a beer garden.

2022-06-03.name: Sun Drop Dayz
2022-06-03.summary: This northwoods town offers music, kids' activities, a car show, flea market, magic show and craft fair, plus samples of the locally made Sun Drops soda.

2022-06-03.name: Milk Days
2022-06-03.summary: The festival in this small town just south of Lake Geneva, Wis., is the longest running in the state. There are milk-drinking contests, milking demonstrations, cow-chip lotto, bed races and a parade Saturday.

2022-06-03.name: Great Wisconsin Cheese Festival
2022-06-03.summary: This Fox Cities festival includes cheese-curd eating, cheese-carving and cheesecake contests and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday cheese parade.

2022-06-03.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2022-06-03.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2022-06-04.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-04.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-04.name: Aquafest

2022-06-04.name: Wisconsin state-parks open house
2022-06-04.summary: Visit a Wisconsin state park without paying the daily vehicle fee, $8-$13 for residents and $11-$16 for non-residents. Many parks host guided hikes and other events.

2022-06-04.name: Outta Sight Kite Flight
2022-06-04.summary: See giant show kites and stunt-flying demonstrations along Lake Michigan in Kennedy Park. There will be kite-making workshops and kite-flying lessons and contests, and the first 100 kids will receive free kites.

2022-06-04.name: Street Faire at the Lakes
2022-06-04.summary: This western-Minnesota lake town hosts a juried arts show with music, fair food and a beer garden.

2022-06-04.name: Sun Drop Dayz
2022-06-04.summary: This northwoods town offers music, kids' activities, a car show, flea market, magic show and craft fair, plus samples of the locally made Sun Drops soda.

2022-06-04.name: Rhubarb Festival
2022-06-04.summary: There’s a Rhubarb Olympics, featuring the Rhubarb Stalk Throw and Green Eggs and Rhubarb, and a Rhubarb Rant Speakers Corner for opinionated folks. The Rhubarb Sisters entertain.

2022-06-04.name: Gospel Music Fest
2022-06-04.summary: This free music festival is at the Jay Pritzker Pavilion in Millennium  Park and across the street at the Cultural Center.

2022-06-04.name: Milwaukee Highland Games
2022-06-04.summary: Listen to bagpipe bands, eat Scottish food and watch sheepdogs, Highland dancers and athletes.

2022-06-04.name: Milk Days
2022-06-04.summary: The festival in this small town just south of Lake Geneva, Wis., is the longest running in the state. There are milk-drinking contests, milking demonstrations, cow-chip lotto, bed races and a parade Saturday.

2022-06-04.name: Great Wisconsin Cheese Festival
2022-06-04.summary: This Fox Cities festival includes cheese-curd eating, cheese-carving and cheesecake contests and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday cheese parade.

2022-06-04.name: Reggae Fest
2022-06-04.summary: The Trempealeau Hotel hosts this easygoing festival on the banks of the Mississippi.

2022-06-04.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2022-06-04.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2022-06-05.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-05.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-05.name: Aquafest
2022-06-05.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-05.name: Buffalo Days
2022-06-05.summary: This festival in the southwest corner of Minnesota features a cow-chip throwing contest, fire-truck ladder rides, duck races, an arts show and a big parade on Saturday.

2022-06-05.name: Fresh Art Spring Tour
2022-06-05.summary: Artists' studios and gardens will be open along the Mississippi and in the bluffs between Maiden Rock and Pepin in western Wisconsin.

2022-06-05.name: Edina Art Fair
2022-06-05.summary: The juried show in this posh southern Minneapolis suburb draws 375 exhibitors and 60,000 people.

2022-06-05.name: Spring Art Tour
2022-06-05.summary: Artists open their studios in Mount Horeb and other towns in the Wisconsin River valley: Mazomanie, Black Earth, Cross Plains, Blue Mounds and Verona.

2022-06-05.name: 2 Rivers Wine Festival
2022-06-05.summary: The festival in this town on the Fox and Illinois rivers features wine from 25 Illinois vineyards and jazz and blues in Washington Park.

2022-06-05.name: Festa Italia
2022-06-05.summary: The heritage festival at McKee Farms Park in this Madison suburb features such things as folk dancing, a puppet show, a pasta-eating contest and vintage baseball as well as bocce ball.

2022-06-05.name: Wisconsin state-parks open house
2022-06-05.summary: Visit a Wisconsin state park without paying the daily vehicle fee, $8-$13 for residents and $11-$16 for non-residents. Many parks host guided hikes and other events.

2022-06-05.name: Outta Sight Kite Flight
2022-06-05.summary: See giant show kites and stunt-flying demonstrations along Lake Michigan in Kennedy Park. There will be kite-making workshops and kite-flying lessons and contests, and the first 100 kids will receive free kites.

2022-06-05.name: Ride the Drive
2022-06-05.summary: This year, the car-free routes are spread out between Marlborough, Wingra, Kennedy and Warner parks, with stops for activities, food and music. You can ride, walk or skate.

2022-06-05.name: Milk Days
2022-06-05.summary: The festival in this small town just south of Lake Geneva, Wis., is the longest running in the state. There are milk-drinking contests, milking demonstrations, cow-chip lotto, bed races and a parade Saturday.

2022-06-05.name: Great Wisconsin Cheese Festival
2022-06-05.summary: This Fox Cities festival includes cheese-curd eating, cheese-carving and cheesecake contests and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday cheese parade.

2022-06-05.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2022-06-05.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2022-06-06.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-06.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-06.name: Aquafest
2022-06-06.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-07.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-07.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-07.name: Aquafest
2022-06-07.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-08.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-08.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-08.name: Aquafest
2022-06-08.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-09.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-09.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-09.name: Aquafest
2022-06-09.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-09.name: Blues Festival
2022-06-09.summary: This year, the largest of Chicago's free music festivals will be held in venues around town as well as in Millennium Park.

2022-06-09.name: Butterfest
2022-06-09.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2022-06-09.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2022-06-09.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.

2022-06-10.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-10.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-10.name: Aquafest
2022-06-10.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-10.name: Blues Festival
2022-06-10.summary: This year, the largest of Chicago's free music festivals will be held in venues around town as well as in Millennium Park.

2022-06-10.name: Butterfest
2022-06-10.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2022-06-10.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2022-06-10.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.

2022-06-10.name: Polish Fest
2022-06-10.summary: This big festival on the lakefront features lots of hearty food, a piano contest, storytelling, vodka-tasting, folk arts and polka dancing.

2022-06-10.name: Spring Lighthouse Festival
2022-06-10.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum in Sturgeon Bay offers tours of the peninsula's 11 lighthouses by foot, boat, trolley, minibus and airplane. Tickets go on sale to the public in March; some tours sell out quickly.

2022-06-10.name: Windsurfing Regatta & Music Festival
2022-06-10.summary: This breezy town in southwest Minnesota hosts windsurfing races on Lake Okabena and a free music festival. There will also be children's activities, a bike ride and a fun run.

2022-06-10.name: Walleye Weekend
2022-06-10.summary: In addition to a fishing tournament, this free family fest features live music on four stages, a Friday parade and strongman, volleyball and cornhole competitions, plus a Familyland for small children and a Teen Village with a climbing wall and giant obstacle course.

2022-06-10.name: Country Thunder Iowa Music Festival
2022-06-10.summary: The country-music festival in this town near Clear Lake features Lee Brice, Kip Moore and Chris Young. There's camping (and glamping) onsite.

2022-06-10.name: Midsommarfest
2022-06-10.summary: This street festival in the historically Swedish neighborhood of Chicago features Maypole dancing, music, international food, an artisan market and children's activities.

2022-06-12.name: Lilac Festival
2022-06-12.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2022-06-12.name: Aquafest
2022-06-12.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, live bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2022-06-12.name: Blues Festival
2022-06-12.summary: This year, the largest of Chicago's free music festivals will be held in venues around town as well as in Millennium Park.

2022-06-12.name: Butterfest
2022-06-12.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2022-06-12.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2022-06-12.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.

2022-06-12.name: Polish Fest
2022-06-12.summary: This big festival on the lakefront features lots of hearty food, a piano contest, storytelling, vodka-tasting, folk arts and polka dancing.

2022-06-12.name: Spring Lighthouse Festival
2022-06-12.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum in Sturgeon Bay offers tours of the peninsula's 11 lighthouses by foot, boat, trolley, minibus and airplane. Tickets go on sale to the public in March; some tours sell out quickly.

2022-06-12.name: Windsurfing Regatta & Music Festival
2022-06-12.summary: This breezy town in southwest Minnesota hosts windsurfing races on Lake Okabena and a free music festival. There will also be children's activities, a bike ride and a fun run.

2022-06-12.name: Walleye Weekend
2022-06-12.summary: In addition to a fishing tournament, this free family fest features live music on four stages, a Friday parade and strongman, volleyball and cornhole competitions, plus a Familyland for small children and a Teen Village with a climbing wall and giant obstacle course.

2022-06-12.name: Country Thunder Iowa Music Festival
2022-06-12.summary: The country-music festival in this town near Clear Lake features Lee Brice, Kip Moore and Chris Young. There's camping (and glamping) onsite.

2022-06-12.name: Midsommarfest
2022-06-12.summary: This street festival in the historically Swedish neighborhood of Chicago features Maypole dancing, music, international food, an artisan market and children's activities.

2022-06-12.name: Marquette Waterfront Festival
2022-06-12.summary: In Yahara Place Park on Lake Monona, there's music on two stages, children's games and craft-beer and wine tents.

2022-06-12.name: Old Town Art Fair
2022-06-12.summary: In the Old Town neighborhood, there will be more than 200 juried fine artists, a garden walk, live music and children's activities.

2022-06-22.name: Swedish Days Festival
2022-06-22.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2022-06-22.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-22.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-26.name: Swedish Days Festival
2022-06-26.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2022-06-26.name: Musky Fest
2022-06-26.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2022-06-26.name: Water Ski Days
2022-06-26.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2022-06-26.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2022-06-26.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2022-06-26.name: Strawberry Festival
2022-06-26.summary: During this popular event in an old mill town north of Milwaukee, there's music, kids' games, a rubber-duck race, shortcake-eating and bubblegum-blowing contests and strawberries in everything  — brats, wine, slush.

2022-06-26.name: Afton Strawberry Festival
2022-06-26.summary: This village on the St. Croix River offers an art fair, music, games, raptor demos and a strawberry shortcake-eating contest.

2022-06-26.name: ChalkFest
2022-06-26.summary: Artists of all ages decorate the 400 Block of downtown.

2022-06-26.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2022-06-26.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2022-06-26.name: Spring Iowa Barn Tour
2022-06-26.summary: This self-guided tour of historic barns concentrates on barns in the historic turkey center of Story City, Ellsworth and Radcliffe.

2022-06-26.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-06-26.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-06-26.name: Midwest Viking Festival
2022-06-26.summary: This festival in Viking Ship Park includes a Viking battle performance, storytelling, artisan demonstrators and Nordic food that tell about society and culture in Viking-age Scandinavia and beyond.

2022-06-13.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-13.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-14.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2022-06-14.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2022-06-20.summary:
